lead_paragraph: Freddy Adu will get his long-awaited first taste of European club soccer when he practices with Manchester United for two weeks later this month. D.C. United and Major League Soccer have given Adu, their 17-year-old star, permission to join Manchester United starting Nov. 18, three days after he is expected to play for the United States under-20 national team against Guatemala in Florida. A D.C. United spokesman, Doug Hicks, said that the practices would not be a tryout and that Adu’s rights remain with M.L.S.
